Posts.Content: Mar 9, 2009 05:37PM suegmomof3 wrote: Dani42 & Jllisucat - thanks - I'm going to send him a card in the mail, from cancer patient to cancer patient, rather than patient to doctor!  I met the nurse who will be doing all of my fills, and she's pretty much who I'll see during the next couple of months.  He has two partners that will seen me if we need their input on how things are progressing.  Likely he will still do the exchange surgery.... so ... we'll go with the flow and see what happens.  (I forgot to mention - when we showed up to the PS Center, there was a sign on the door saying "Do Not Enter - Building Closed".  We saw people in the lobby so we entered and asked them what was going on ... apparently there had been a fire in the building earlier this morning which caused an evacuation. The power was off, and most of the offices were closed.  EEK! I drove 2 hours to turn around and go back home???  Well we decided to go to the PS Office and see if anyone was there.  Indeed the nurses and staff were still there, seeing the morning appts (and calling to cancel the afternoon appts).  So I did get to see the Dr after all.  My stitches and drains were removed by the nurse while my mom held a Coleman lantern and the nurse held a flashlight (I'm not kidding!!!).)  What a strange experience to have happen!
Posts.Title: February Surgery jillisucat 2new1s

Posts.Content: Mar 11, 2009 05:32PM suegmomof3 wrote: Hi Hope4Cure, I had those tingly chills - uncontrollably shaking - the first couple of days I was home from the hospital after a BM on 2/27.  I thought I was developing a fever as well, so took my temp but it was normal.  I wonder if it was almost "shock" or something due to the trauma my body has been through?  The chills have gone away for the most part now though ... I had the itchy thing happen again today but I haven't had a pain pill since yesterday noon.  I took some Advil but they didn't do much ... I may try some Benadryl tomorrow with my Norco to see if that helps.  I seem to have a little area w/fluid built up on the left end of my incision on my left breast... I'm watching it to see if it grows ... but will probably call the dr tomorrow just in case (my drains were pulled Mon).  I don't want it to grow larger ... and if it needs to be drained, I'd like to have that done before the weekend since my first fill is scheduled for next Thurs.   Will see how things go!  take care, ladies -- sue
Posts.Title: February Surgery jillisucat 2new1s

Posts.Content: Mar 15, 2009 11:39AM suegmomof3 wrote: Samiam40 and Caligrlof68 - I have the same thing with my skin on my chest!  I wondered if it was some type of reaction to lotion or soap, but I haven't used anything different ... it drives me crazy because it kind of hurts and itches at the same time ...... sue
Posts.Title: February Surgery jillisucat 2new1s

Posts.Content: Mar 22, 2009 06:05AM suegmomof3 wrote: Hope4Cure - My first fill was not painful at all during the procedure ... only later did I feel the pain.  Just be sure to take your Advil or Motrin or something stronger .. I'm still very sore today but Advil helps a lot.  i go for my next one on Thursday, probably right around the time I'm feeling better!  It's exciting to see the changes so early, though .  Good luck!!!!!
Posts.Title: February Surgery jillisucat 2new1s

Posts.Content: Mar 29, 2009 08:19AM suegmomof3 wrote: I am so confused why PSs have such different opinions & instructions.  I was told to do the exercises to prevent frozen shoulder immediately after my BLM.  Even with my drains in!  I was told NOT to wear any type of sports bra  .... that it is best to go without any bra so that the pockets are allowed to form where they need to .... so I haven't worn anything and it's been 4 weeks.
Posts.Title: February Surgery jillisucat 2new1s

Posts.Content: Apr 9, 2009 12:23PM suegmomof3 wrote: jpixstix:  I'm so jealous of you!! That's awesome that you're getting your exchange sooner!  I went for my 4th fill today and have 3 more scheduled ... my PS waits 8 weeks inbetween the last fill and the exchange, so I've got a ways to go ... likely July.  I'll be looking forward to hearing about how everything goes for you in a couple of weeks!!  Hope everything goes well and you stay infection-free!  sue
Posts.Title: February Surgery jillisucat 2new1s

Posts.Content: May 24, 2009 06:39PM suegmomof3 wrote: 2new1s - thanks for the kind words.  My daughter did great - didn't cry or fuss or anything!  They put some numbing ointment on the bumps, and then used a little "scooper" scalpel to scoop them off.  She felt a couple of them, but she was a big girl and toughed it out.  They think it's a benign condition caused by a poxlike virus - young children get them because their immune systems haven't developed enough to fight it off. Fortunately hers didn't spread as much as it can, and we should be done with it. They are going to do a path report on the tissue, but he was 99.9% confident it was not anything to worry about. Michele - SO GLAD your thyroid turned out to be benign.  I had the same thing a few years ago - had half of it removed and am now taking synthroid on a daily basis.  What a relief for you.  Jillsucat/Dani42 - I wanted to get that t-shirt for a b/c benefit concert I'm having in june, but then thought, man, enough people are going to be staring at my boobs (cuz they know I've had them reconstructed, at least partially at this point), I decided not to ... I think I'll opt for a cute black tank top with no writing.    If anyone is in the mid-Michigan area, you're invited to the concert!!  I have an acoustic duo of brothers who will start at 7 pm, followed by Brian VanderArk, lead singer of popular Mich band "the Verve Pipe" who has had a hugely successful solo career these last few years.  The date is Sun June 14 - Location is 1309 N. Parkway in Midland.  Last year we had over 100 people attend a similar event for Big Bros/Bis Sis, but this year, I decided to benefit ACS and Susan G. Komen ... for obvious reasons. I'm hoping for 150 people - we'll see!!!!  Gentle hugs to all - I can't wait until my exch surgery in July.  Dani42 - if we get the same date, that would be so great!! For sure keep in touch on here so we can compare notes.  I'm just hoping they get the size right.  Now I'm probably a DD which is HUGE ... I'd like to be a full C/small D, so we'll see.  My PS keeps telling me that I am one of the lucky ones that can expect a really great result because I stretched so well .... I just hope they're right.  I've become so used to these TEs (which I never ever thought I would!) that I am used to popping out of all of my tops .. ha ha ha.  My hubby is getting used to me being huge too ... .I keep reminding him that I will be smaller after July! Take care, Ladies -- so glad we have this wonderful site to come to. sue
Posts.Title: February Surgery jillisucat 2new1s

Posts.Content: Jun 13, 2009 07:04PM suegmomof3 wrote: I am SO happy for you!!  I've been following your journey through the boards, and I'm so glad that you've got your TE replaced .... WAY TO GO!!!  Hope your recovery and expansions go smoothly ....   sue
Posts.Title: February Surgery jillisucat 2new1s

Posts.Content: Jul 14, 2009 11:35PM suegmomof3 wrote:
Posts.Title: February Surgery jillisucat 2new1s

Posts.Content: Mar 1, 2009 10:36AM suegmomof3 wrote: Well I am through what I hope was the worst experience of my life ... My surgery was delayed a few hours due to a schedule change so I went in around 10 am and got out around 2ish to the recovery room.  Post Op is a haze -- I remember crying and having a hard time breathing due to the incredible pain.   They gave me some anti anxiety medicine & upped the pain med which finally got me to the point where I could focus a bit ... My DH has earned his angels' wings these last few days .. he has been amazing.  I never got to  my own room - they put me in an Observation Area so we were in curtained-off "rooms" manned by nurses in the middle.  I ended up with the most wonderful nurse that evening - she was just incredible helping me to & from the bathroom, with meds, etc.  The morphine pump ended up making me nauseous (actually vomited twice - NOT a fun experience) even with the anti-nausea meds ... They removed the IV late morning on Fri and switched me to pain pills which helped.  Plus I think it was just getting that anesthesia out of my system before I finally felt better.  The  2  hour car ride was painful - I ended up sleeping/dozing for most of it, but then the last 30 mins I was fighting nausea until we got home.  My kids are staying at my brother's house for the weekend whihc was a great idea ... peace & quiet is all I want right now.  Their welcome home poster was adorable and made me miss them all the more ... but they'll be coming back home tomorrow. My husband has become my nurse and has taken care of stripping / emptying the drains - he's doing an awesome job of everything.  We removed the dressings today and cleaned the drainage site - it wasn't as bad as I was anticipating and really I wasn't as emmotionally crushed like I thought I would be.  I have 180 ccs in each expander implant from Thursday and I'm supposed to see the PS on the 9th for  my first post op visit (unless I reach the lower levels and can get my drains removed before then).  I actually went outside for a walk on the court today with my husband to get some fresh air and sunshine .. it's freezing cold but it felt great just walking slowly.  I am about ready to lay down for another nap - he's going to build a fire for us this afternoon so it will be a relaxing afternoon/evening.  Thanks for all of the help and information on this site - it's been wonderful to read your experiences & advice - that helped me tremendously!!! Best wishes to everyone else in their various stages of recovery.....sue
Posts.Title: February Surgery jillisucat 2new1s

Posts.Content: Mar 4, 2009 04:18AM suegmomof3 wrote: Hi Ladies, I have a question - a scab is forming around my left drain site -- should we try to "swab" it clean with the hydro peroxide/water mixture?  Or is it okay to allow it to develop?  I don't have one on the right drain site ... I don't see the PS until Monday for my first follow up, although my drain levels are really decreasing, I might be able to get them removed sooner than Mon.  I'm VERY sore today - didn't sleep well last night compared to the other nights here at home ... not sure why?  Maybe I'm doing too much during the day & need to take more meds? I'd started spreading out the pain pills to about 8 hrs instead of every 4 .... I don't think I'll do that today. I'm just generally not feeling as well today ... tired, sore throat (hope that is from the tube and not from a developing cold) and achy in my chest.  Anyway ... thought I'd try to get input on the scab question ... thanks!  sue
Posts.Title: February Surgery jillisucat 2new1s

Posts.Content: Mar 17, 2009 01:23PM suegmomof3 wrote: WOW - 400 CCs in your first fill?  Amazing 2new1s!!!  I can't wait to see what they give me on Thursday!!  I'll post once I'm home ...  I've kept some Norco on hand so if I need them, I've got them.  :)   jpixstix - way to go - no chemo!!  You must be relieved.  Enjoy the sun, everybody - I was outside with my kids all afternoon (ok, I sat on a chair while they played, but it still felt GREAT to be outdoors!)  sue
Posts.Title: February Surgery jillisucat 2new1s

Posts.Content: Mar 19, 2009 06:48PM suegmomof3 wrote: Hi Ladies, well I made it through my first fill!  The needle pokes didn't hurt a bit -- the expansions didn't really hurt either - just felt pressure and some tightness.  She put 120 cc in the right, and 100 cc in the left - so I'm at 300 and 280 respectively.  They look noticeably larger which is nice!  Once I got home, then the pain started ... I took some Norco and then got nauseous - almost lost my dinner.  Now the nausea is gone, but the pain is definitely back.  Not sure what I'll take tonight - maybe just some Advil.  Anyway ... one fill down, and three more scheduled over the next 3 weeks.  I keep thinking my shirt is too tight and then I realize it's not my shirt, it's those darn TEs that are so restricting ....  small price to pay though ..... Good luck to my560sel - it is a tough decision.  I think it would be good to get a 2nd opinion as well ... you've got to do what you feel comfortable with.  I had DCIS in my left breast and opted for a PBM which was Feb 27.  Take care everybody!! sue
Posts.Title: February Surgery jillisucat 2new1s

Posts.Content: May 21, 2009 04:31AM suegmomof3 wrote: 2new1s, I'm still around too ... just been crazy busy with 3 kids and SPRING.  :)  I have my exchange date set for July 14 so I'm in "limbo", just waiting for the day to arrive.  Until then, I still stop by and browse my fave threads (this being one of them), but feel I typically have nothing new to add since I haven't had any more fills and nothing is going on until the surgery.  Please take care and continue to keep in touch!  Off to take my 5 yr old daughter to a dr appt - she has funky little bumps on the back of her legs (only 5 of them ... but last year it was 1, and now they've spread).  So I'm taking her to a procedure specialist to see if he can remove them.  That oughta be fun, huh?  Happy Spring, everybody!  sue

I plan on trying to get back to walking at the indoor track as soon as I can so I don't become a total couch potato.  :)  peace to all, sue

Posts.Content: Mar 10, 2009 06:43PM suegmomof3 wrote: One drain out - another to go - way to go, Caligrl.  Quick question for you ladies -- have any of you had an allergic reaction to your pain meds?  Today I had a few epsidodes of extreme itchiness all over my chest and back - kind of tingly weird sensations that I've never had before.  Made me wonder if I'm having some kind of reaction to my hydrocordone - I'm going to go off and google it now......  hang in there, everybody!!  sue
Posts.Title: February Surgery jillisucat 2new1s

Posts.Content: Mar 17, 2009 04:50AM suegmomof3 wrote: Hope4cure & mooma, I hear you!  I am still sleeping on the couch propped up by pillows. I tried returning to my bed over the wknd (my hubby's getting too comfy without me in there) but didn't sleep at all ... so back to the living room.  I have constant pain and discomfort on the sides where the drains were too ...  I'm off the Norco but am taking Advil throughout the day.  It doesn't totally remove the pain, but at least it dulls it for me.  I go for my first fill on Thursday and I'm curious to see how that's going to go.  I have to live with the expanders for about 4 months which puts me around mid-summer for my exchange surgery as long as everythign goes well.  Good luck & hang in there .. I look forward to the morning that I wake up and don't have the pain.... sue

I have my 2nd fill on Thursday -- I'm very nervous because I am very tight and uncomfortable from last week's first fill!  How will they get more in there?  ah well ... off to bed.  g'night ladies!  sue

Posts.Content: Jul 27, 2009 06:11PM - edited Jul 27, 2009 06:29PM by suegmomof3 Hi Dianne- so glad that your first day went so well!! Yeah!!  I've been worrying about you lately ... just give it some more time and see how they look.  It's only been two weeks for us (as of tomorrow!  wow .. time flies!) and mine are looking better too.  I tried on my old bras and none of them fit ... guess that means I get to go to VS for some pretty bras!  Not sure what size I'll be, so I'm waiting about another month before I spend a penny.  Take care!!!   And know that we're all here for you!!!!
Posts.Title: February Surgery jillisucat 2new1s

Posts.Content: Mar 4, 2009 09:59AM suegmomof3 wrote: Hi Deen, Hope you're feeling better too!  My days have been a lot of resting on the couch, homeschooling my kids while my mom helps out too, and doing email/reading on the internet.  I find that tv gives me a headache so I try not to watch too much.  Since my kids are home with me all day, they provide a nice distraction (but also some noise).  This afternoon I told them they can watch a movie after we go outside for a short walk - it's warm here today!  They don't get to watch many movies so it'll be a treat for them, and I can lay down and rest.  I've been doing my stretching exercises and my armpits hurt .. not my chest so much, but my armpits, go figure.  I took a shower today adn washed my hair (I kept my camisole on and sat on a ledge in my walkin shower - it worked great - the incision and drain sites kept nice & dry, but I was able to clean my arms and bottom half of my body pretty easily.  WAshing my hair in the laundry tub was another huge success - makes me feel so much more human even if I'm not drying it / styling it. Question - you were filled with 350cc??? WOW!!!  I only got 180 CC so I'm tiny compared to what I used to be - a 38D.  I'm pretty flat with pouchy hanging sacks waiting to be filled.  :)  I see the PS on Monday so we'll see  when that process starts.  Hang in there !!  I hope to hear from the drs with my path report tomorrow ... hope we don't get a surprise.  take care, sue
Posts.Title: February Surgery jillisucat 2new1s

Posts.Content: Mar 4, 2009 04:35PM suegmomof3 wrote: Just had to post the great news - my path report showed NO invasive components, the lymph nodes were clear, and the margins were negative.  WOW ... that was the best news I could have received!!  Thank God .... Now I can focus on making it through the reconstruction process over the next few months.  Thanks for the advice on the scab - I called the PS's office and the nurse recommends I try to work it loose rather than let it continue to grow and harden. So that's tonight's project.  :)    My thoughts are with all of you ... sue
Posts.Title: February Surgery jillisucat 2new1s

Posts.Content: Mar 8, 2009 06:13PM suegmomof3 wrote: Dani42 - oh my .. I have no idea how you'd go back to work already !  I am 9 days post op and finally left my house for the first time today to go to church, a concert, and then took my daughter to open gym.  I am havign horrible pains on my right lower side, I'm guessing from the tissue expander ... it's a type of pain I haven't had before and I'm not sure why it's bothering me so badlyl now.  Maybe I did too much or moved a bad way?  (maybe shutting the car door did it to me?)  anyway - take it EASY!!  Tell your boss or whoever you need to talk to that it's just too much for your body to handle right now and you need more time ... don't feel bad ... it's just the way it is ....... get your rest.  And I"ll try to follow my own advice.  :)  Tomorrow I go to my first post-op visit with both surgeons - I hope I get these drains out!!!  restful healing -- sue
Posts.Title: February Surgery jillisucat 2new1s

Posts.Content: Apr 15, 2009 05:11AM suegmomof3 wrote: Hi Stacy - I am supposed to be getting up to 650-700 ccs and should be a D .. but everyone's frame is different.... I told them I only wanted to be a C but the PS/PA told me I needed to go larger to fit my body ... that I would have "hollow" areas if I went smaller.  Their goal is to not focus on cup size, but focus on the amount of CCs that fit me.  So ... I am going to trust they know what they're doing.  I've got 3 more fills to go (I'm at 500 ccs right now and I am maybe a B cup) and then we meet with the PS for his final review and implant selection.  sue
Posts.Title: February Surgery jillisucat 2new1s

Posts.Content: Apr 30, 2009 07:23PM suegmomof3 wrote: HI Michele, Just wanted to give you a word of encouragement ... I had an enlarged thyroid for quite a while - had some testing done to see if it was considered "hypo" but it wasn't ... then about 10 yrs later during a yearly exam, the dr (not my normal doc, but a different one) was feeling my lymph nodes and noticed the thyroid ... she felt it needed to be looked at again.  so I had some ultrasounds taken and a needle biopsy.  It was not cancer, but they felt it needed to be removed since it had changed.  So I had half of my thyroid removed two years ago ... I now take synthroid every day.  No problems with it whatsoever ... so hang in there!  Just because it's enlarged doesn't mean cancer .... it could just be a "funky" thyroid like mine!  :)  Good luck!!! sue
Posts.Title: February Surgery jillisucat 2new1s

Posts.Content: Jun 30, 2009 05:51AM suegmomof3 wrote: Eternal Optimism:  Hang in there - you'll get through everything, and you've come to the right place for support & advice!!  I had a double masc on Feb 27 and had expander implants placed at the time of that surgery with 125 CCs put into each one.  I waited two weeks, then started with my weekly fills.  It took 7 weeks to get up to 650 CCs, then my PS wanted to wait at least 8 weeks before the exchange surgery.  I am scheduled for my exch on July 14 (can't believe it's only 2 weeks from today!).  Some PSs don't wait that long after the last fill and the exch surgery, so you should check with your surgeon to see what kind of approach he takes.  right now I appear to be larger than I was prior to my masc (I was a C, and I think I'm a DD now), but I should go down to a D after the permanent implants are put in.  I wish you the best as you start your journey.  For me, the pain was manageable after the masc and the fills - I had my ups & downs during that whole process, for sure, but just be sure you don't overdo it and take it easy.  Your body will need time to recover from the fills.  Some women breeze through them, others take it real slow due to pain and discomfort.  I am still sleeping on the couch though because a bed just doesn't work well with these expanders in.  I can't wait to get them replaced with the softer & more comfortable implants.  Take care!!!!!!  there are other ladies here who can help you with questions you may have about types & sizes of implants for your body type/size ...   Everyone is so kind here. sue
Posts.Title: February Surgery jillisucat 2new1s

Posts.Content: Feb 19, 2009 06:50PM suegmomof3 wrote: I'm having a double MX Fri Feb 27th with immediate TE reconstruction.  Had my preop appt today and everything went great.

Posts.Content: Mar 9, 2009 02:01PM suegmomof3 wrote: Hi Ladies, I can totally relate to the pain ... I did get my drains pulled out today - yowsa!  I was not expecting that to hurt, but it almost made jump off the table!   It stopped hurting soon after, though, and it was a small price to pay to be RID of those things.  Yeah!  I can shower for real on Wednesday and I can't wait.  The dr & nurse said everything is looking great and I go for my first fill next week - another thing to celebrate!!!  On a sad note, my PS told me today that he's been diagnosed with prostate cancer and will be out of pocket for a couple of months due to surgery ... he hopes to be back at work right around the time my exchange will be due, so he'll likely still get to do my surgery ... but how sad - someone who works with cancer patients is now becoming one himself.  the sun is out, my drains are out, and today was a good day.  :)  Take care everyone - sue

Posts.Content: Apr 25, 2009 11:57AM suegmomof3 wrote: Hi 2new1s - I totally relate ... I feel guilty though for doing it!!  Why is that??  I just am wiped out from my fill on Thurs ... I am having way more pain this last time (I'm up to 600 ccs and feel like I'm going to explode), and don't feel like doing a dang thing.   maybe some day (hopefully soon) I'll get my energy level back .......................hang in there! Michele - it's great to hear how wonderful you're feeling!!  Gives me some hope for my exchange .... my PS waits 8 weeks betw the last fill and the surgery, so I've got about 9 weeks or so before I get rid of these awful TEs.  sue

Posts.Title: 100 things never to say to a woman who has had a mastectomy: iwannabefree jillyG
